title: What our insiders are hearing about the biggest teams in NBA free agency
content: Free agency begins at 6 p.m. ET. Here are the latest rumblings from across the league, from potential free agent targets to trades. Watch the 'NBA Today Free Agency Special' at 7 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: Fins, Steelers swap Ramsey, Fitzpatrick in trade
content: The Dolphins have agreed to trade All-Pro cornerback Jalen Ramsey and tight end Jonnu Smith to the Steelers in exchange for All-Pro safety Minkah Fitzpatrick and a pick swap.

title: Sources: Teams mulling trade offers for T.J. Watt
content: In recent weeks, multiple teams have been discussing whether they can trade for Steelers standout pass rusher T.J. Watt, who skipped the team's most recent minicamp, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Jazz finalizing buyout with vet Clarkson
content: Jordan Clarkson is finalizing a contract buyout with the Utah Jazz, which will make the veteran guard an unrestricted free agent.

title: Aces get Smith from Wings for '27 1st-round pick
content: Forward NaLyssa Smith, who is averaging 6.7 points and 4.9 rebounds, has been traded from Dallas to Las Vegas for a 2027 first-round draft pick.

title: Sources: Batum returning to Clippers after opt out
content: Free agent forward Nicolas Batum intends to sign a two-year, $11.5 million deal to return to the LA Clippers, sources told ESPN.

title: Thunder's Jalen Williams to have wrist surgery
content: Thunder forward Jalen Williams will undergo surgery to repair a ligament tear -- originally sustained in March -- in his right wrist after managing the injury through the team's championship run.

title: Pac-12 welcomes Texas St. ahead of '26 relaunch
content: After a $5 million buyout to the Sun Belt was approved, Texas State has officially joined the Pac-12 as the ninth member ahead of the conference's relaunch in 2026.

title: 🔮 A new kind of MLB mock draft -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades, trash talk and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: 2026 NFL mock draft: Miller's early projections for the first round, including four QBs
content: What might the Browns and Rams do with their first-rounders? How many QBs could go on Day 1? Here's Matt Miller's early look at the 2026 draft.

title: Experts' picks: Who will win Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon kicks off with a wide-open women's field and some clear favorites on the men's side. Our experts make their predictions.

title: What to know about WNBA expansion to Cleveland, Detroit and Philadelphia
content: Why is the WNBA expanding now? How will it impact the CBA and draft? What will more roster spots and NBA ownership mean?

title: USMNT's grit, character are shining at Gold Cup, which will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself during the Gold Cup -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure. No matter the situation, this team can come out on top.

title: Winning the offseason? Here are the biggest surprise players on each NFL team
content: Some are fighting for starting spots while others are battling for key depth roles. Here's who have made an early impression.

title: NHL free agency preview: How each team can earn an A+
content: With the market set to open Tuesday, we identify key free agents for each club -- and what each GM should do.

title: 'This is a startup': Meet the man in charge of policing the new world of college sports
content: Overseeing athlete payments in college sports may seem like a thankless, nearly impossible job. But Bryan Seeley thinks he's up to the task.

title: Jordan Love weds Ronika Stone; David Bakhtiari seemingly trolls Aaron Rodgers in congrats post
content: Jordan Love tied the knot with Ronika Stone over the weekend, and former Packer David Bakhtiari seemingly trolled Aaron Rodgers in congratulatory post.

title: 'Who are these menaces?' How Supreme kick-flipped the fashion game
content: Inspired by the skate scene in New York City during the 1990s, designer James Jebbia opened Supreme, starting a cultural phenomenon.

title: Is Jake Paul ready for a world title fight? Who is his best option?
content: Following his victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr., Jake Paul called out the cruiserweight champs. But can he get them in the ring?

title: Caitlin Clark's status, 3-pointers and fast-break points: Keys to Tuesday's Commissioner's Cup final
content: Minnesota has set the bar for consistency this season. Indiana? Not so much. And Caitlin Clark's status is uncertain.

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: Fight grades: UFC 317 was the best pay-per-view of 2025
content: UFC 317 gets the best report card of the year so far. It was all-around entertaining and included one near-perfect fight.

title: Freese saves 3 in USMNT win: 'Penalties my thing'
content: United States goalkeeper Matthew Freese said he was well prepared and studied up on penalties after providing three saves in a dramatic 4-3 shootout victory over Costa Rica in Sunday's Gold Cup quarterfinal.

title: FIFPRO: U.S. temps a concern for '26 World Cup
content: FIFPRO has raised concerns over the effect of intense heat during the FIFA Club World Cup in the United States by saying that two games -- Paris Saint-Germain-Atlético Madrid and Chelsea-Esperance -- should have been postponed due to extreme heat.

title: Torrent: Time with Pep key vs. 'superior' Dortmund
content: Monterrey head coach Domenec Torrent admitted his team faces a superior opponent in Borussia Dortmund in the Club World Cup round of 16 on Tuesday night at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, but he expects the Liga MX side to compete well.

title: Neymar to play until 'I can no longer perform'
content: Brazil forward Neymar has said he will continue playing football until he can 'no longer perform' as he wants to.

title: Liverpool's Hinds leaves club amid Arsenal talks
content: Liverpool Women have confirmed vice-captain Taylor Hinds has decided to leave the club, with a source telling ESPN she is in talks with Arsenal.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree $82M deal for João Pedro
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth a total of £60 million for Brighton striker Joao Pedro, sources have told ESPN.

title: Only terrible agent can stop Gyökeres exit - chief
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has admitted that Viktor Gyökeres is likely to leave the club this summer.

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Video: Odisha Officer Dragged Out Of His Office, Kicked In Face, 3 Arrested
content: High drama unfolded in the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) office today after a senior official was assaulted by a group of men.

title: 'No Magic Wand To Be Like 20-Year-Old, Know Where To Stop': Khushbu Sundar
content: Actor Khushbu Sundar has pointed at 'fear of missing out' or FOMO as one of the key contributing factors that adds immense strain on the lives of young people and those in the entertainment industry to stay in top shape externally.

title: Analysis - Hindi Row: D Fadnavis' Masterstroke Or Thackeray Brothers' Win?
content: The withdrawal of the government resolution regarding the teaching of Hindi in Maharashtra's primary schools is being viewed differently across the state's political spectrum.

title: Trump Administration Threatens New Harvard Cuts Over Jewish Right
content: The Trump administration on Monday accused Harvard of violating the civil rights of its Jewish and Israeli students and threatened to cut off all federal funding if the university does not take urgent action.

title: 'No Money To Buy Books Twice': Parents On Chhattisgarh Syllabus Order
content: In Chhattisgarh, schools open in April. However, it seems the Education Department prefers surprise tests, not just for students but for parents too.

title: 3 Ceasefire-Linked Kuki Militants And Bystander Shot Dead In Manipur's Churachandpur
content: The deputy chief of a Kuki insurgent group which is among the 17 armed groups under the banner of the Kuki National Organisation (KNO) was shot dead in an ambush in Manipur's Churachandpur today, sources said.

title: Depressed Over Death Of Parents, Brother, Navi Mumbai Man Didn't Leave Home For 3 Years
content: Navi Mumbai resident Anup Kumar Nair had isolated himself and had remained locked in his house since 2022, following the death of his parents.

title: Days After Stampede, Bengaluru Stadium's Power Cut For Violating Safety Norms
content: The power supply to M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru was cut Monday for failing to comply with safety norms, NDTV has learnt.

title: 13-Year-Old Girl Fakes Own Kidnapping, Leaves Rs 15 Lakh Ransom Note: Cops
content: A 13-year-old girl in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur staged her own kidnapping and left behind a fake ransom note demanding Rs 15 lakh - all because she was upset with her mother's scolding over using a mobile phone.

title: High Court Denies Bail To Man Who Shared Post With "Pakistan Zindabad" Slogan
content: The Allahabad High Court has rejected the bail plea of Ansar Ahmed Siddique, who allegedly shared a Facebook post with the "Pakistan zindabad" slogan.

title: India Nears Starlink Rollout as SpaceX Clears Regulatory Hurdles
content: India is on the cusp of a major leap in digital connectivity as SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet service inches closer to operational status in the country.

title: Harvard Violated Civil Rights of Jewish, Israeli Students, Trump Officials Say
content: The Trump administration said a US investigation found that Harvard University violated civil rights law in its treatment of Jewish and Israeli students, further endangering federal funding for the school.

title: Iconic Eatery Jimmy Boy Shuts Down Mumbai Outlet. Here's How You Can Still Eat Its Food
content: The closure of Jimmy Boy's restaurant in South Mumbai was followed by an outpouring of social media posts from patrons that have sworn by the its scrumptious fare.

title: 'Not Talking To Them Since We...': Trump Says Not Open To An Deal With Iran
content: US President Donald Trump said Monday he was not offering Iran anything nor talking to it "since we totally obliterated" the country's nuclear facilities.

title: BJP Gets New State Chiefs, Moves Closer To Elect New National President
content: BJP moved towards rolling out the exercise to have a new national president as the party elected chiefs in some states and is set to announce more on Tuesday, which will put the requisite number of state heads to pick the new party President.

title: "When Terrorism Is Supported By State Against...": S Jaishankar At UN
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said it is imperative to call out terrorism publicly when it is supported by a state against a neighbour and is fuelled by the bigotry of extremism, a strong reference to Pakistan.

title: Rs 512-Crore Fake GST Scam Busted In Madhya Pradesh, Mastermind Arrested
content: In what could be one of the biggest GST frauds uncovered in central India, the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has unearthed a fake invoicing scam worth Rs 512 crore and fraudulent Input Tax Credit (ITC) claims of Rs 130 crore.

title: Manipur Civil Groups Hold Talks With Centre In Delhi. What They Said: 10 Points
content: A 19-member delegation of three top civil society organisations in Manipur met with Union Home Ministry officials in Delhi today and discussed a phased and time-bound roadmap for peace in the border state where ethnic clashes broke out in May 2023.

title: Kolkata College Student's Rape, Its Video Recording Was Planned By Accused: Report
content: Investigating officials probing the rape of a law college student at Kasba in Kolkata revealed that the accused Monojit Mishra targeted the survivor in a pre-planned manner.

title: 38 hrs after AI 171 crash: AI Boeing 777 got stall, GPWS alerts on Delhi take-off
content: Shortly after takeoff from Delhi on June 14, an Air India Boeing 777 bound for Vienna experienced a stall warning and ground proximity warning, leading to a significant altitude loss. Pilots successfully recovered the aircraft, and the flight continued safely to its destination.

title: Jaishankar at UN: ‘No impunity to terrorists’; slams proxies and nuclear blackmail
content: S. Jaishankar urged the international community to unite against terrorism, emphasizing zero tolerance and accountability. He inaugurated "The Human Cost of Terrorism" exhibition at the UN, showcasing global terror attacks, including the Pahalgam strike. Jaishankar called for exposing state-sponsored terrorism and highlighted the exhibition's tribute to victims, urging the UN to act decisively against this grave threat.

title: New CM in Karnataka? Kharge gives 'high command' hint; Sidda-DKS put up united front
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge hinted at a possible leadership change in Karnataka, stating the party high command has the power to act. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dismissed rumors of discord with Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, affirming their government will remain stable for five years.

title: 'Will not rest till Bihar becomes developed state': Who is Chirag targeting - oppn or Nitish?
content: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan's recent remarks about contesting the Bihar assembly polls with a "Bihar First, Bihari First" agenda have stirred political waters. Despite being an NDA ally, his statements seem to target Nitish Kumar's leadership. Paswan aims to win considerable seats so that he can have a greater say in deciding NDA's leadership in Bihar post assembly elections.

title: ‘Promise kept’: Trump signs executive order ending US sanctions on Syria
content: Donald Trump ended US sanctions on Syria through an executive order. This fulfilled his promise made during a Middle East visit. The move followed the formation of a new Syrian government led by Ahmed al-Sharaa. Sanctions on Bashar al-Assad and related entities remain. The US Treasury eased restrictions on Syrian banks and infrastructure projects. European Union also lifted sanctions.

title: Amazon founder’s last minute text sends plane full of tequila to Venice
content: Venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya gifted Jeff Bezos a case of his ultra-premium tequila for his Venice wedding to Lauren Sánchez. Palihapitiya mentioned Bezos's last-minute request on X. The wedding, a lavish three-day affair reportedly costing $50 million, saw celebrity guests like Bill Gates and Kim Kardashian.

title: 'Very strategic ally': White House confirms US-India trade deal 'very close'
content: The White House has reaffirmed the strong strategic alliance between the United States and India, signaling the potential completion of a long-awaited trade agreement. Officials are finalizing the details, with an announcement expected soon from President Trump and his trade team.

title: ‘Axis of upheaval’: How China, Russia ghosted Iran - when it mattered most
content: American B-2 bombers struck Iranian nuclear sites. This led to a ceasefire between Tehran and Tel Aviv. China and Russia did not intervene. Analysts viewed this as a failure of the anti-Western alliance. The Iran-China-Russia partnership is based on convenience. Beijing and Moscow are hesitant to risk their interests. The US may recalibrate its strategies. Iran may reassess its allies.

title: 2nd Test, India's playing XI puzzle: Bumrah's uncertainty, Kuldeep-Washi face-of?
content: India’s Edgbaston Test selection hinges on Bumrah’s fitness and the spin combination. Dry conditions favour two spinners, with Sundar, Jadeja, and Kuldeep vying for spots. Kuldeep’s X-factor could be crucial if Bumrah is rested. The team faces a tricky balance between batting depth and wicket-taking potency.

title: OpenAI is shutting down for the next week; CRO Mark Chen warns employees
content: OpenAI is temporarily closing down operations next week. This is to allow employees to rest after long work hours. Meta is trying to recruit OpenAI staff with high salary offers. Mark Chen warned OpenAI staff about Meta's tactics. Meta recently hired some OpenAI researchers. OpenAI is planning to change its compensation strategy.

title: Scars of strikes: Iran begins repairs at Fordow nuclear site, new satellite images reveal
content: Following US and Israeli strikes, satellite images reveal extensive damage and ongoing reconstruction at Iran's Fordow nuclear site. Construction crews are actively repairing access roads and working near the complex's northern shaft. While the UN nuclear watchdog confirms the centrifuges are non-operational due to "enormous" destruction, Iran maintains its nuclear program remains peaceful.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Sure two spinners will play' - India assistant coach reveals playing XI secrets
content: India contemplate a two-spinner strategy for the crucial second Test against England, with Washington Sundar's all-round abilities potentially securing his place. Jasprit Bumrah's participation remains uncertain due to workload management, while young Nitish Kumar Reddy is nearing his debut. England, buoyed by their Leeds victory, have named an unchanged XI for the Edgbaston encounter.

title: Infosys vs Cognizant: Infosys files fresh charges in US court; names 2 senior Cognizant employees
content: Infosys has accused Cognizant executives, including Chief People Officer Kathryn Diaz and Surya Gummadi, of orchestrating a targeted poaching effort to weaken its Helix healthcare platform. This accusation follows earlier claims against Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar S, alleging he stalled Helix's rollout before joining Cognizant.

title: Army chief in Bhutan to bolster ties amid China’s continuing build-up at Doklam
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi is on a crucial four-day visit to Bhutan, reinforcing strong military ties amid China's growing infrastructure in the Doklam plateau. He will meet King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck and Lt General Batoo Tshering.

title: 'Maintain work-life balance’: Infosys asks staff not to work overtime
content: Infosys is actively promoting work-life balance among its employees. The IT giant is monitoring remote work hours and cautioning staff against extended periods, citing potential health concerns. Personalized emails are sent to employees exceeding the prescribed 9.15 hours a day, five days a week.

title: 'In North India, we're trained thugs': The harsh truth behind nation's North-South divide
content: Chess culture differs greatly between North and South India. Vantika Agrawal highlights the lack of recognition for chess players in the North. In contrast, Tamil Nadu provides strong support, including financial aid and flexible schooling. This fosters a competitive environment. The challenge is to create a unified chess community. This will allow talent from all regions to flourish equally.

title: Body language reveals bond: Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce's NYC dinner clues
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce recently captured attention in Manhattan. Their coordinated style and affection suggest a deep connection. Body language expert Judi James notes their 'prom-queen and king' aesthetic. Travis Kelce's style seems to mirror Swift's. His gestures indicate he takes the relationship seriously. Their body language suggests a couple in the early stages of romance.

title: Hills in havoc: Buildings crumble, roads blocked in Himachal; Uttarakhand on high alert
content: India is bracing for above-normal rainfall in July, with the IMD warning of potential floods in Uttarakhand and Haryana. Central and northern regions are expected to receive heavy showers, while the northeast and parts of the southern peninsula may experience below-normal rainfall. Landslides and infrastructure damage have already been reported in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and Jammu & Kashmir, prompting authorities to issue alerts and suspend activities.

title: India to see above-normal July rainfall; Northeast, East & South may face deficit: IMD
content: India is expected to receive above-normal monsoon rainfall in July, benefiting agriculture but also posing risks of flooding in central regions. While most of the country will experience normal to above-normal rainfall, northeast and parts of east, extreme south peninsular, and northwest India are likely to receive below-normal rainfall.

title: 'Stronger together': Dwyane Wade, Gabrielle Union on first-marriage mistakes
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, both previously married, have built a strong and enduring marriage. They attribute their success to learning from past mistakes, prioritizing open communication, and supporting each other's careers. Despite challenges, including a brief separation and Wade fathering a child with another woman, they've created a blended family and continue to thrive.

title: Watch: Sharapova, Beckham's surprising Wimbledon appearance; cricketer also there
content: Wimbledon 2025 kicked off with a star-studded guest list, including tennis legend Maria Sharapova and football icon David Beckham. Sharapova, soon to be inducted into the Tennis Hall of Fame, shared a selfie with Beckham, who watched from the Royal Box alongside Eddie Redmayne and other notable figures like England cricket legend Stuart Broad.

title: Inspired by Buffett? These 3 stocks make up 66% of Gates Foundation's $45 bn portfolio — check list
content: Bill Gates, seemingly guided by Warren Buffett's value investing, strategically directs the Gates Foundation's investments. The foundation's portfolio is heavily concentrated in Berkshire Hathaway, Microsoft, and Waste Management. These holdings reflect a long-term, value-oriented approach, contributing significantly to the foundation's philanthropic endeavors and demonstrating a commitment to sustainable growth and impact.

title: Shefali Jariwala’s friend Pooja Ghai confirms she took Vitamin C IV drip
content: Shefali Jariwala’s close friend and actor Pooja Ghai revealed that Shefali had taken a vitamin C IV drip on the day of her passing. She also revealed that police officers present at Shefali’s residence summoned the person who had administered the IV drip. The tragic incident reportedly took place between 10 and 11 PM when Shefali collapsed at home. She was immediately rushed to the hospital by Parag Tyagi but could not be revived.

title: GTRI warns of huge risks to lowering duties on US farm goods amidst trade deal talks
content: The GTRI cautions against lowering import duties on US farm products in the proposed India-US trade agreement, citing risks to India's food security and the livelihoods of 700 million farmers. Subsidized US agricultural exports, including rice, dairy, and GM soy, could overwhelm Indian markets and distort prices.

title: Mavericks target D’Angelo Russell: $12M offer in play
content: D'Angelo Russell, after concluding the season with the Brooklyn Nets, is reportedly targeted by the Dallas Mavericks in free agency. The Mavericks are preparing a two-year, $12 million offer to address the void left by Kyrie Irving's injury. Despite Russell's expressed desire to remain in Brooklyn, the Nets' shift towards a younger roster makes his future uncertain.

title: New regional power bloc? Pakistan, China planning to replace Saarc
content: Pakistan and China are reportedly developing a proposal for a new regional organization, potentially replacing Saarc. Discussions have progressed significantly, emphasizing regional integration and connectivity. A recent meeting in Kunming included Pakistan, China, and Bangladesh, with plans to invite other former Saarc members, including India, Sri Lanka, Maldives and Afghanistan.

title: Kolkata rape case: Attack 'premeditated'; victim targeted from day one of admission
content: "The entire matter was premeditated. The trio had been plotting for several days to carry out this torture on the victim. We have found that the victim was targeted by the prime accused from the very first day she got admission to the college," the officer was quoted as saying by the news agency PTI.​​

title: India hardens stance on farm sector concessions as India-US trade talks stretch
content: India-US trade talks extend as the Indian government твердо stands firm on agricultural concessions, prioritizing the interests of its farmers. While the US seeks deals before reciprocal tariffs take effect, India is wary of one-sided agreements. Industry representatives have suggested compromise, but the government emphasizes a balanced outcome, with a limited initial deal and further tranches expected.

title: IND vs ENG: No Archer! England name playing XI for 2nd Test against India
content: England announced their team for the second Test against India on Monday. The match starts on Monday at Edgbaston. The team remains largely unchanged after their recent win. Jofra Archer has left the squad due to a family emergency. His inclusion would boost England's pace attack. India aims to recover after losing the first match.

title: Connor McDavid’s birthday bash: Lauren Kyle hosts outdoor dinner
content: Connor McDavid celebrated his birthday with an elegant alfresco dinner hosted by his wife, Lauren Kyle. The event served as a reunion for current and former Edmonton Oilers players and their spouses, highlighting the strong bonds within the team's community. The intimate soiree, filled with laughter and warm interactions, showcased the enduring relationships formed through years of playing together.

title: 'No one can stop me': Tej Pratap meets 'partner' Anushka; defends visit post-RJD expulsion
content: Expelled RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav visited Anushka Yadav in Patna, asserting a "parivaarik" relationship despite his recent expulsion from the party. Lalu Prasad Yadav ousted Tej Pratap for violating moral values after a social media post where Tej Pratap confessed a 12-year relationship with Anushka.

title: Mitch Marner bids emotional farewell as Maple Leafs brace for bold new era
content: Mitch Marner’s heartfelt farewell to the Toronto Maple Leafs signals a major turning point for the franchise, with his emotional exit interview and past-tense reflections. As free agency inches closer, Marner’s silence on staying and the team’s vague stance on contract talks make one thing clear, Toronto is preparing to move forward without him. The quiet farewell feels less like rumor and more like an accepted reality, with both player and franchise ready for a split.

title: ‘Captain Cool’ trademark: MS Dhoni’s move to secure his legacy - details inside
content: MS Dhoni, the celebrated former Indian cricket captain, is seeking to trademark his iconic nickname, 'CAPTAIN COOL,' for sports-related services. The application has been accepted and advertised. This move coincides with Dhoni's upcoming induction into the ICC Hall of Fame in 2025, recognizing his exceptional leadership, tactical brilliance, and contributions to cricket.

title: Roman Reigns return update: Tribal Chief’s WWE absence explained
content: Roman Reigns is set to make a comeback at SummerSlam 2025. WWE is preparing for his return with promotional activities. A major storyline is planned around Reigns. He may face Seth Rollins' faction or CM Punk. A power struggle within The Bloodline is also possible. Reigns' Hollywood plans will not affect his WWE schedule. The WWE Universe awaits his return.

title: ITR filing: How can you switch between old & new tax regimes? Explained
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25:  Like every year, for AY 2025-26, taxpayers must choose between the new and old income tax regimes when filing ITR. The new regime is the default. Salaried individuals can switch annually by filing on time, while those with business income face stricter rules and must submit Form 10-IEA to opt out of the new regime.

title: Telangana factory blast: Amit Shah expresses grief, says NDRF continuing rescue operation
content: A devastating explosion at a pharmaceutical factory in Telangana's Sangareddy district resulted in 12 fatalities and 34 injuries, prompting immediate response from NDRF and local authorities. Preliminary investigations suggest a pressure build-up in the drying unit as the cause.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Bumrah is available but ...' - India assistant coach Ten Doeschate
content: Following a defeat at Headingley, India contemplates whether to field Jasprit Bumrah for the second Test, despite workload management plans limiting his appearances. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirms Bumrah's availability, but the decision hinges on long-term strategy. Nitish Kumar Reddy might debut, offering balance if Bumrah rests, highlighting India's focus on sustained success.

title: Denied visa, Pak couple crosses border for new life; perishes in Thar desert
content: A Pakistani couple, Ravi Kumar and Shanti Bai, who crossed the international border near Jaisalmer, tragically died of thirst and dehydration. Their bodies were discovered with an empty jerry can, highlighting their desperate struggle. Despite visa rejections and warnings, they sought a better life in India, leading them to cross illegally and become lost in the desert.

title: 3-language policy row: CM Devendra Fadnavis labels Uddhav Thackeray 'palturam'
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis criticized Uddhav Thackeray, labeling him "palturam" after reversing the three-language policy due to opposition pressure. Fadnavis clarified that the BJP-led government supports all national languages, including Hindi. He pointed out that Thackeray's own administration had previously mandated Hindi instruction based on the Raghunath Mashelkar Committee's recommendations.

title: Railways notifies fare hike: New ticket prices effective July 1 - check details
content: Indian Railways has announced a slight increase in passenger train fares, set to take effect on July 1, 2025. The Ministry of Railways states that this adjustment aims to enhance service sustainability and streamline fare calculations. While suburban journey fares remain unchanged, there are marginal hikes across various classes, including both non-AC and AC categories in Mail/Express trains.

title: Javed Akhtar reacts to recent husband murder cases: ‘Bada besharam hai samaaj...’
content: Veteran lyricist and screenwriter Javed Akhtar has weighed in on the public anger surrounding the brutal murder cases of Raja Raghuvanshi and Saurabh Rajput, allegedly orchestrated by their wives Sonam Raghuvanshi and Muskan Rastogi, respectively. In a recent interview, Akhtar admitted he felt “mixed emotions” about the national response to these cases.

title: National-level boxer alleges sexual harassment by woman coach; FIR filed
content: A minor female boxer has accused a coach at the Sports Authority of India of sexual harassment. The victim's parents reported mental and physical abuse. The Boxing Federation of India and SAI confirmed receiving a complaint. However, they denied sexual harassment allegations. An FIR was filed, and police are investigating.

title: Post office schemes: Govt notifies latest rates - check PPF, SSY, NSC interest rates here
content: Post Office Small Savings Schemes Interest Rate July-September 2025: The government has announced that interest rates for small savings schemes, including PPF, NSC, SCSS, and SSY, will remain unchanged for the July-September 2025 quarter, marking the sixth consecutive quarter of static rates.

title: Pep: CWC 'not ideal,' but other clubs jealous
content: Pep Guardiola has accepted that participation in the FIFA Club World Cup could "destroy" Manchester City's season but has hinted that other clubs not in the tournament are jealous they are not taking part.

title: Guatemala dumps Canada in Gold Cup shootout
content: Jose Morales buried the winner in the seventh round of penalty kicks to propel Guatemala over Canada and into the semifinals of the Concacaf Gold Cup on Sunday in Minneapolis.

title: Flamengo coach: 'Fact' Europe has 'better players'
content: Flamengo coach Filipe Luis said it was a "fact" the football elite remained in Europe after the Brazilian side were beaten 4-2 in a last-16 clash against Bayern Munich at the Club World Cup on Sunday.

title: 24 in 24: Rodriguez nets in another USWNT debut
content: Defender Izzy Rodriguez and midfielder Sam Meza were the two latest players to wear the USWNT shirt in a match for the first time under Hayes and Rodriguez scored.

title: Messi: Miami 'left a good image' despite CWC exit
content: Inter Miami CF left-back Jordi Alba said the team lived up to the expectations of the Club World Cup despite falling 4-0 to Paris Saint-Germain in the round of 16 to be eliminated from the competition.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool ready to offer player as part of Guéhi deal
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Guéhi could see one of their promising young attackers go the other way. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: How Wiegman's 'new England' have evolved ahead of Euro 2025
content: England won Euro 2022 but have undergone some changes in the three years since. How are they looking ahead of their title defense?

title: Which teams' drafts get an A? What about a C-minus? We have grades for all 30
content: my team grades for the 2025 draft are the only ones you'll read that aren't concerned with results . no team, not even the Brooklyn Nets, drafts enough players in one year . trades are also considered .

title: Toddler dies after falling into boiling pot in UP, sister died same way 2 years ago
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . kajol’s no-makeup look 10 profound lessons from Gautam Buddha that help the best to navigate through life are too inspiring to miss Bollywood's yesteryear divas with long tresses 10 beautiful succulents that will look perfect in the balcony garden 10 stunning lehenga looks .

title: Club World Cup offers clues about Messi's role with Argentina in 2026
content: Messi will play for argentina at the 2026 FIFA world cup . the 38-year-old will be playing for his national team next summer . he will play at the international level in a competition he faces week in .

title: Carvajal: 'I'll play anywhere' in Xabi's Madrid setup
content: Dani Carvajal says he is ready to play in any position in Xabi Alonso's team . the 33-year-old has been impressed by new coach xabi alonso tactics . defender will play anywhere, even in between the posts, he says .

title: Al Hilal keen to show their level vs. Man City at Club World Cup
content: new al Hilal coach Simone Inzaghi says the tournament is so important for his team . inzaghi believes pep Guardiola will be happy with his team after a goalless draw against FC Salzburg . he says he's not coming here just to be in the group of the best in the world .

title: As it happened: Jake Paul dominates, defeats Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.
content: the judges scored the fight 99-91, 97-93 and 98-92 . the fight is now riding a six-fight winning streak since losing a split decision to Tommy Fury . Paul defeated former heavyweight king Mike Tyson by unanimous decision in November .

title: Who won and what questions remain after recruiting's busiest month
content: the most active month of the 2026 recruiting cycle is drawing to a close . Florida, Texas and Texas A&M led the charge among the nation's recruiting risers . Alabama, LSU and Ohio State stand among the prominent football powers poised to rise in July .

title: ‘Complicated, takes time’: China on border row with India, says open to delimitation talks
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Who's next for Ilia Topuria, Charles Oliveira, Alexandre Pantoja after UFC 317?
content: former featherweight champion Ilia Topuria knocked out former lightweight champion Charles Oliveira in the UFC 317 title fight . the men's flyweight division took center stage as topuria picked up knockout wins over Alexander Volkanovski and Max Holloway .

title: Dubai’s futuristic leap: First aerial taxi test flight completed
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Suit accusing BYU QB Retzlaff of rape dismissed
content: a civil lawsuit accuses BYU quarterback Jake Retzlaff of rape has been dismissed . the parties agreed to dismiss with prejudice, ending the case last month . he faces a possible seven-game suspension for violating the school's honor code .

title: Women's Euros A-Z: The history of the tournament in 26 facts
content: the 2025 women's european championship kicks off in Switzerland on friday . a is for ... angerer, Nadine: Switzerland's goalkeeping coach and former Germany custodian earns five euros winners' medals .

title: After a tough French Open, Naomi Osaka is optimistic about Wimbledon
content: Naomi Osaka lost first set to Paula Badosa at the french open last month . the 27-year-old struggled to speak in her news conference soon after . she apologized for cursing before sitting back in her chair .

title: Grading all 32 NHL draft classes: From one A-plus to multiple Ds
content: a team with three first-round picks might have a lower grade . the grade is weighted against the expectation of what teams could reasonably have done with their selections based on my model and team need . every team is getting a draft grade, regardless of how many players they selected .

title: Can Alcaraz and Gauff win another major? What about Djokovic?
content: defending champion Carlos Alcaraz says he "wants to be ready" for the tournament . the two-time french open champions are among the favorites again as the tournament begins . aryna Sabalenka and Iga Swiatek could win a record-breaking 25th grand Slam title .

title: Seven underrated NBA free agents -- and teams that should sign them
content: the top five free agents in ESPN's rankings are All-Stars . they've all exercised a player option or already agreed to new contract terms with their current teams . there are seven free agents worth targeting as the frenzy begins this week .

title: Transfer window: What do Europe's big clubs still need?
content: the transfer window has been a bit different this year thanks to the FIFA Club World Cup . but international deals will be officially going through in the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A on July 1 . we asked our ESPN reporters to assess the business still needing to happen .

title: Police resort lathi-charge in Bhogandih on the occasion of Hul Diwas
content: Jharkhand Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president and Leader of opposition Babulal Marandi strongly condemned the incident calling it a barbaric act on the tribal community.

title: Bihar BJP attempts to break RJD’s Muslim votes through Pasmanda
content: State president Dilip Jaiswal said that in Bihar, politics has always been done in the name of Muslims, but no real efforts were ever made to uplift the Pasmanda Muslims. He also assured their political representation.

title: Congress leader challenges Haryana power tariff hike, files review petition
content: The tariff revision, which came into effect in April, has been met with resistance from various consumer categories, including industrial associations and domestic users

title: Unauthorised halt by private buses poses challenge to school
content: The problem persists despite repeated pleas to bus operators and several memorandums submitted to officials concerned

title: Tripura government orders probe into assault of two school students
content: The students of the State’s first higher education school were allegedly assaulted by seniors after the former refused to purchase alcohol for them

title: A year after enforcement of new criminal laws began, T.N. government works on more State amendments
content: In its first list of State amendments proposed to the Government of India, it has sought changes in the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita

title: Stalin’s inaction has resulted in custodial deaths, says L. Murugan
content: Speaking to journalists in Tiruchi, he alleges that the police are neither listening to the Chief Minister nor following his instructions

title: First State-led digital public infra for AI TGDeX set for launch in Telangana on July 2
content: TGDeX is aimed at developing cross-domain AI solutions through collaboration between the State, startups, industry partners and research institutions

title: Journalism stalwart Dasu Krishnamoorty turns 100 today
content: Hailing from a family of journalists, Krishnamoorty belonged to the first batch of journalism students at Osmania University in 1954-55

title: MeeSeva expanded to issue market value certificates, marriage registration bookings
content: The inclusions are part of its expanding suite of services and reinforces its position as a trusted gateway for Telangana citizens, IT and Industries Minister D.Sridhar Babu’s office said

title: Border dispute with India complicated, takes time; ready to discuss delimitation, says China
content: Rajnath Singh, in his meeting with Chinese counterpart Dong Jun in Qingdao on June 26, proposed that India and China should solve the “complex issues” under a structured road map comprising steps to de-escalate tensions along the frontiers and rejuvenate the existing mechanism to demarcate the borders

title: A.P.’s Polavaram–Banakacherla project fails to get environmental clearance
content: Central Water Commission should be consulted for a comprehensive evaluation of floodwater management and addressing environmental and inter-State concerns, says EAC

title: Bengal police summon Padma-awardee monk after woman alleges rape
content: Trinamool, which posted photographs of the monk with top BJP leaders, says the BJP is shielding the accused. Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar hints that the accusation might be politically motivated.

title: M.P. HC issues notice to Centre, NHAI over long traffic snarls on Indore-Dewas highway
content: Over the past few days, long queues of vehicles were witnessed on the highway causing over 30-hours of jam on Friday

title: SC survey: 91.84% of projected population enumerated
content: After multiple extensions, Monday was the last day of the survey by the commission headed by Nagamohan Das

title: Independent probe sought in gang rape of law college student case
content: Calcutta High Court admits PILs for independent investigation into the gang rape case; BJP delegation visits college

title: Senior officer dragged from office, beaten up in Bhubaneswar
content: The attackers were linked to a senior BJP leader who unsuccessfully contested the State Assembly election in 2024; former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik criticised the Mohan Majhi government

title: Post-stampede, police training manual revised with learnings from incident, CPR training now mandatory
content: Karnataka Police Academy has taken up the incident as a case study and has prepared a detailed learning points module

title: Austria could be a turning point for Norris' F1 title charge
content: a 1-2 finish at the Austrian Grand Prix with Lando Norris finishing first and Oscar Piastri in second . the victory provided a succinct answer to his critics . norris has shifted a title narrative that appeared ready to write him off following his disastrous Canadian Grand Prix .

title: Manipur civil society groups discuss peace process with Home Ministry officials
content: The groups — Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity, All Manipur United Clubs’ Organisation, and Federation of Civil Society Organisations — discuss peace roadmap and restoration of popular government

title: Classes at South Calcutta Law College suspended, as protests erupt over rape of student
content: Bharatiya Janata Party supporters clashed with the police and other protestors in various parts of the city on Monday, June 30, as a four-member fact-finding team of the saffron party arrived in the city

title: Army Chief embarks on four-day visit to Bhutan
content: The visit reflects the deep-rooted and time-tested ties between India and Bhutan, and reaffirms India’s commitment to a close and trusted partner, a press statement said

title: Toll on NICE Road hiked effective July 1
content: Tolls on other access controlled corridors like the Electronics City Expressway have also been hiked with effect from July 1

title: States must announce cooperative policy by January 31, says Amit Shah
content: The Union Home and Cooperation Minister chaired a “Manthan Baithak” with all the States’ Cooperation Ministers, emphasising the importance of GDP, GSDP growth and job creation for the country

title: Defence Ministry set to clear major acquisitions post Operation Sindoor
content: Spy aircraft, air defence missile systems, sea mines, and autonomous vessels on agenda at upcoming DAC meeting

title: Voter verification drive in Bihar: too little time, too many hurdles
content: Within a month, a staggering 4.76 crore people will have to prove their citizenship in order to vote in the next election

title: Language row turns political: MVA, MNS claim victory as Maharashtra govt. backtracks
content: Facing intense backlash from civil society and Opposition parties, the Maharashtra government has rescinded two govt. resolutions mandating Hindi as a compulsory third language in schools; the State will now form an expert committee to review the language policy and suggest a way forward

title: PM Modi’s five-nation tour likely to focus on defence cooperation, Africa outreach, and multilaterals
content: The Prime Minister is visiting Ghana, Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, Brazil, and Namibia on July 2-9; he is also participating in the BRICS summit while in Brazil

title: India to get above-normal rain in July, forecasts IMD
content: States such as Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and Telangana should be watchful as catchment areas of rivers such as the Krishna, Godavari, Mahanadi could receive heavy rain, the Met office says

title: L.V. Prasad vision centre opened at Mandadam
content: A free walk-in clinic, accessible to everyone regardless of socio-economic status, it is equipped to perform both anterior and posterior segment examinations, along with teleconsultation facilities

title: 683 species added to India’s fauna, 433 taxa to its flora during 2024
content: With 101 species, Kerala recorded highest number of fauna discoveries, followed by Karnataka — 82; Tamil Nadu recorded 63 discoveries

title: Trafficking serious issue, regulate dance groups, Patna HC tells Bihar govt.
content: Highlighting the large-scale exploitation of children, especially minor girls, in orchestra groups, Just Rights for Children urged the High Court to direct the creation of a State-level coordination mechanism

title: ‘I am not under pressure,’ says Dhankhar as Gehlot alleges pressure on LS, RS presiding officers
content: The V-P Jagdeep Dhankhar, who is the Rajya Sabha Chairman, says, “Neither do I exert pressure on anyone nor do I operate under pressure”

title: Railways announce fare rationalisation from July 1 after five-year gap
content: Suburban fares remain unchanged; long-distance and AC classes see minor hike aimed at boosting revenue

title: Frame stringent anti-ragging law, Kerala HC tells State government
content: Kerala Veterinary and Animal Sciences University is directed to initiate departmental proceedings against the petitioners in connection with death of Sidharthan J.S. and to finalise the same within three months

title: MoEF-EAC returns appraisal proposal of A.P.’s Polavaram-Banakacherla Link Project
content:
The expert panel asks AP to get assessed availability of flood waters with CWC, get clearances before submitting proposal again for ToR
Letters addressed by Telangana Govt. CWC, MoJS, representations by others too have impact on EAC observations

title: Tiger deaths at M.M. Hills: DCF, ACF sent on compulsory leave
content: The order says that despite the carcass of five tigers being found just 100 metres from an asphalt road, it did not come to the attention of the department staff for two days which is a very serious lapse

title: India to fast-track 52 military satellites for better surveillance at borders
content: Govt. builds on lessons from Operation Sindoor where satellite surveillance proved to be an important asset

title: Change of guard in Karnataka: Kharge says only high command will take a call
content: AICC president warned legislators and party leaders against creating ‘unnecessary complications’ by talking out of turn

title: QUAD nations launch coast guard cooperation initiative
content: The observer-at-sea engagement marks a first-of-its-kind initiative among the Indian Coast Guard, Japan Coast Guard, United States Coast Guard, and Australian Border Force

title: Bihar has consistently lagged in registering births, shows government report
content: The report comes in the backdrop of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, which is currently going on in Bihar, that has stipulated conditions to establish a child’s date of birth

title: First responders take charge as emergency response remains slack
content: People and workers from the surrounding areas dug through brick, mortar and concrete blocks debris to pull out bodies and the injured

title: Cabinet approves new KEAM mark normalisation formula
content: Revised formula necessitated by complaints that students in the State syllabus were losing 15 to 20 marks in the earlier normalisation process when KEAM scores where combined with higher secondary marks, especially in core subjects like Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics

title: After doctor’s FB post on issues affecting patient care, govt.-appointed panel visits Thiruvananthapuram MCH
content: The four-member committee took statements from Dr. Haris Chirackal as well as other heads of department at Thiruvananthapuram MCH on the manner of equipment/accessories purchase, process delays they encounter and how the systemic issues were affecting patient care and service delivery.
